intro: Hieraciodes cretica, commonly known as Cretan hieracium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Crete. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. It produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieraciodes cretica is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
